text: Matthew Dickie (19 August 1873 – 30 December 1959) was a Scottish professional footballer who is best known for his time with Rangers. Dickie made his Rangers debut against St Mirren in a 5-1 home win at Ibrox on 15 August 1896. He played 126 league matches from a possible 132 in an amazing spell during his time at the club. He went on to make 175 first class appearances in total. Dickie won four League championships, 3 Scottish Cups, 5 Glasgow Cups and represented Scotland three times. ==References== ;Sources * Category:1873 births Category:1959 deaths Category:Rangers F.C. players Category:Clyde F.C. players Category:Scotland international footballers Category:Scottish footballers Category:Association football goalkeepers Category:Renton F.C. players Category:Scottish Football League players Category:Scottish Football League representative players Category:People from Rhu, Argyll and Bute Category:Place of death missing Category:Sportspeople from Argyll and Bute
title: Matthew Dickie
